CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 3, 1955, pg. 4 reads: "Before Owl's Greenlight - Before appearing before Common Pleas Court Judge Clarence B. Nixon, opposing sides in Owl Cab Company battle, agreed in the courtroom corridor that the petition by Silas Knox, to place the company into the hands of a receivorship, should be dismissed. Judge Nixon signed the consent order which gave Owl's new management a legal greenlight for its plans for efficient city service.  Shown with Atty. Paul F. Jones who said that Owl's new management already had given the taxicab concern a clean bill of health, are, left to right, Gus Jones and Melvin Phillips, stockholders...-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Gus Jones, Melvin Phillips, and Atty. Paul F. Jones, posed in corridor of Allegheny County Courthouse
